intro: Senecio sonsonensis, commonly known as the Sonsonense groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually grayish-green and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
